description: Kaprekar numbers, allowing powers of 10: n such that n=q+r and n^2=q*10^m+r, for some m >= 1, q>=0 and 0<=r<10^m. Here q and r must both be m-digit numbers.
comments: Powers of 10 were excluded in Kaprekar's original definition (A006886).
references: D. R. Kaprekar, On Kaprekar numbers, J. Rec. Math., 13 (1980-1981), 81-82.
D. Wells, The Penguin Dictionary of Curious and Interesting Numbers. Penguin Books, NY, 1986, 151.
links: D. E. Iannucci, The Kaprekar numbers, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 3, 2000, #1.2.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Kaprekar Number
Index entries for Colombian or self numbers and related sequences
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from Michel ten Voorde (seqfan(AT)tenvoorde.org), Apr 13 2001
